alert.note: Alert for Ellsworth; Lincoln; Russell; Saline (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 2:57AM CST until January 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with some locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause blowing snow and very low visibilities at times. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerous bitter cold wind chills. Wind chills of 15 to 35 below zero are likely. * WHERE...Russell, Lincoln, Ellsworth and Saline Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM Thursday to noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Snow and blowing snow could significantly reduce visibilities at times and create poor road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The bitter cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
